DataElement.preferredName: Chest Abdominal Cavity Pelvis Diagnostic Imaging Negative Metastatic Neoplasm Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of a scan of the chest, abdomen and pelvis which ruled out evidence of residual or metastatic disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chest Abdominal Cavity Pelvis Diagnostic Imaging Negative Metastatic Neoplasm Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a diagnostic imaging evaluation (any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues) of the chest (the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm), abdominal cavity (that portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis), and pelvis (the structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs) being performed and a negative finding (a finding of normality following an examination or investigation) of metastatic disease (a tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Chest Abdominal Cavity Pelvis Diagnostic Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:That portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.:The structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs in humans and the hind limbs or corresponding parts in other vertebrates.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.:A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology. -- 2004:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Date of scan of chest, abdomen and pelvis which rules out evidence of residual or metastatic disease
